name: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PMP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS & Work Pack
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PMP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, Work Pack
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencement of excavation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Area has been set out in accordance with the drawings
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: An excavation permit must be issued prior to any excavation commencing.
○ Plant and equipment shall be appropriate for the task.
○ Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Placing fill shall not commence on the prepared areas until the area has been reviewed by the Superintendent
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Area reviewed by Superintendent, Signed ITP
○ Where groundwater is encountered the contractor shall notify the superintendent and submit proposed action for review.
○ The Contractor shall submit any necessary approvals from relevant authorities for the treatment and disposal of this groundwater
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off, Work Procedure
○ No fill shall be placed against or within 3 m of a structure until the foundation for the fill has been reviewed by the Superintendent.
2.6 - Compaction of Fill next to Structures

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The permeable fill material shall be placed in conjunction with the adjacent fill in layers not exceeding 150 mm compacted thickness, and compacted to refusal using hand operated 120Kg vibratory plate compactor.
○ Compaction plant shall not be operated within the minimum distances from structures shown in Table 204.111

○ The difference in level of any fill being placed on opposite sides of a structure or structural component shall not exceed H/4 or 500 mm, whichever is the lesser, where H is the height of the structure.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: DSG Spec. Cl. 204.11(b), Drawing 0320-0321
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off, Work Procedure
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Supply of Imported Topsoil meets requirements of Specification Section 720 and Table 720.03, at a minimum depth of 75mm
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: DSG Spec. Cl. 720.03, Table 720.031, Table 720.051
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Landscaping and/or Grassing as per NOAW Agreements, drawings
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Notice of Acommodation Works, Drawing 0320-0321
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Proof rolls to be conducted in accordance with Section 173, before proceeding to subbase construction.

○ The Contractor shall submit a test rolling procedure to the Superintendent including the method of preparing an area for test rolling, the extent of test rolling and a requirement to provide not less than 24 hours notice of the location and commencement time for the test rolling to the Superintendent.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Refer to Reference Documents for particular Frequency of Testing and Material Properties Testing Requirements.
○ Table 204.161 for Project Specific Scales for each applicable Road Name or Area.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed, Test Records
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
1.1 - Obtain the TasWater Engineering Design Approval
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that project drawings are listed on the engineering design approval document and that it has not expired during time of construction
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to receiving the permit to construct, a pre-start meeting between responsible contractor and TasWater relevant project manager and ground crew is to be held on site.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
1.3 - Apply for and obtain permit to construct
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: prepare and submit application for a permit to construct no less than 10 business days before commencing any activities.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
1.4 - Preparation and submission of construction management plan
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prepare a construction management plan. This must detail how the new TasWater infrastructure will be constructed while maintaining current levels of services provided by TasWater to the community.
○ The construction plan must also include a risk assessment and contingency plans covering major risks to TasWater during any works.
○ The construction plan must be to the satisfaction of TasWater.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
1.5 - Request and schedule booking for a witness pressure test with TasWater
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: After new section of main is installed, TasWater must witness a pressure test of the new section of main.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
1.6 - Request and schedule the isolation and cuttover to new infrastructure
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: A permit for shutdown must be applied for through the TasWater Application for Development Services portal. A minimum of 2 weeks notice must be given to TasWater before required service isolation so that affected residents and businesses can be made aware through a letter drop
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
1.8 - Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PMP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS & Work Pack
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PMP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, Work Pack
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencement of excavation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Area has been set out in accordance with the drawings
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: An excavation permit must be issued prior to any excavation commencing.
○ Plant and equipment shall be appropriate for the task.
○ Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: As above with excavation permit. Ensure any known and previously proven services are marked on the ground prior to excavation commencing.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
2.4 - Installation of pipework (including new property connection).
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pipework is installed as per certified and approved Water Main Relocation design drawings
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
2.5 - Installation of thrust blocks (temporary and permanent)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Thrust blocks are installed as per MRWA-W-204
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off, TasWater written approval
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Installation of pipes/valves/hydrants/thrust blocks prior to backfill
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: TasWater Permit to Construct
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off
2.7 - Back-fill of trench for purpose of pressure testing

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pipework is back-filled as per A0171.005 using pipe embedment to either WSA-PS-361 if 5mm clean back-fill or WSA-PS-360 if sand to 70% compaction and 20mm crushed rock to 95%R compaction above.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: A0171.005 Sheet 0240, 0241, WSA-PS-360 OR WSA-PS-361
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off, Delivery dockets, Compaction test results
2.8 - Removal of old section of water main
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Removal of existing water main following successful cuttover to new section of water main. Method of removal will be mechanical excavation.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed Off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Hydrostatic Pressure testing 1.25 times the designed working pressure as claculated by the Supervising Engineer in accordance with section 19.4 of WSA 03-2011-3.1 Water Supply Code of Australia Part 2: Construction Third Version 3.1
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed, Test Records, TasWater written approval
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: TasWater to isolate existing watermain to allow for the cut-over from the existing section of water main to new.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed, Test Records, TasWater written approval
